授業目的: The purpose of this course is to learn about minority populations and issues and to critically assess the way in which society is influencing and is influenced by media etc. but also to examine our own biases and prejudices. In this globalized world we need to be able to understand and relate with people of other cultures respectfully.
到達目標: Students will learn to identify types of discrimination and racism and understand its connection in society, and to develop ways to better understand and relate with people of other cultures. Students will examine multiculturalism, inclusion and equity issues in Canada, diversity in Japan and study the influences of history, economics, and sociological factors such as the media for examination and analyses of biases and prejudices. Specific objectives of the course are to have students: become aware of their own biases and prejudices; be exposed to and learn from minority populations in Japan and other countries; be sensitized to intolerance that is based on race or ethnicity; consider ways to handle these issues in an increasingly global, diverse, changing society.
授業方法: Course format will include readings, lectures, guest lecturers, facilitated discussions, and media and communications analyses.
